Ginger has been used for thousands of years in Asia as a traditional medicine.

Turmeric has been used in Ayurveda and traditional Chinese medicine.
Turmeric has anti-inflammatory properties and can improve digestion.
May cause digestive issues if consumed excessively.
Turmeric can be consumed as herbal drinks, supplements, or as a cooking spice.
Galangal has long been used in traditional Indonesian medicine.
Galangal is good for digestive health and can relieve pain.
Excessive consumption may cause stomach irritation.
Galangal is used in cooking, herbal drinks, or herbal tea.
Java ginger is a native Indonesian plant often used in herbal medicine.
Java ginger helps boost appetite and supports liver health.
May have a laxative effect if consumed excessively.
Java ginger can be consumed as herbal drinks, extracts, or tea blends.
Lemongrass has been used since ancient times as a natural remedy and spice.
Lemongrass has antibacterial properties and is good for detoxification.
May cause allergic reactions in some individuals.
Lemongrass can be used in tea, cooking, or as an essential oil.
